pageProps.content:
![Kidzania Seoul (ÌÇ§ÏûêÎãàÏïÑ ÏÑúÏö∏)](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031380_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Kidzania, located in Jamsil, Songpa-gu, Seoul, is a unique family entertainment space especially for children ages 3 to 16. The theme park provides children with a chance to experience jobs that they might want to have when they grow up! Job experiences include working as a policeman, flight attendant, firefighter, or chef (uniforms are provided). When you work hard in Kidzania, you get paid in Kidzo (a virtual currency). You can put your money in the bank for your next visit or purchase goods at the department store. In order to make the environment as realistic as possible, every building, car, and tree is reduced to 2/3 its real size, helping children feel more adult-like in their new world! Kidzania mimics a real city environment, has diverse jobs, and is full of events. When there is a fire, a fireman rushes to help, and a news reporter covers the story. While 911 paramedics give first aid to fire victims, in another part of ‚Äútown‚Äù delivery personnel are dropping off packages. Kidzania teaches the next generation how to live as responsible members of society and gives them an introduction to how the economy works. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-1544-5110| |opendate:|February 27, 2010| |parking:|Available| |restdate:|N/A (Open all year round)
* Subject to closure; refer to the website for details| |usetime:|Session 1 10:00-15:00
Session 2 15:00-19:30
All-day pass (Session 1 & 2) 10:00-19:30| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Film Locations:|Various variety shows| |Available Facilities:|[Experience facilities]
Bank, acting school, driving tracks, fire emergency department, flower atelier, extreme climbing, voice recording studio, hospital, robotics laboratory, photo studio, TV studio, police station, radio studio, magic school, and more.

[Convenience facilities]
Information center, storage lockers, lost and found, nurse office, parents lounge, nursery, etc.

[Restaurants & others]
Kidzania Cafeteria, multishop, Airshop, National Store, Kid's Corner, Snow Town, Candy Shop, Smoothie King, Lotteria, etc.| |Restrooms:|Available| |Admission Fees:|Children: Session 1 42,000 won / Session 2 38,000 won / All-day pass 61,000 won
Guardian: Session 1 19,000 won / Session 2 17,000 won / All-day pass 20,000 won
3-Hour Ticket - Children 25,000 won / Guardian 11,000 won
(Session 1 - Admission after 12:00 / Session 2 - Admission after 16:30)

* Children (ages 3-16) / Guardian (ages 17 and older)
* Children below 10 years old must be accompanied by a guardian
* Guardians are not allowed to enter without accompanying a child
* Babies (ages 3 or younger): Free admission (participation in hands-on programs not allowed)| |Parking Fees:|Weekdays - First 3 hours free / 3,000 won charged for additional 3 hours
Weekends & public holidays: First 3 hours free / 11,200 won charged for additional 3 hours
* Guests using Lotte World parking lot can apply for 3 free hours at the Kidzania information desk.| |Reservation Info. for Foreigners:|Tickets can be purchased on-site| ## Detail Image ![/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031376_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031376_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031379_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031379_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031381_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031381_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031382_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659656133025/2031382_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-1544-5110](tel:+8215445110) - [üè†www.kidzania.co.kr](http://www.kidzania.co.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.5110683960 longitude: 127.0981394766 title: 240, Olympic-ro, Songpa-gu, Seoul ``` ## Directions [Subway]
Jamsil Station (Seoul Subway Line 2), Exit 4.
Go straight 300m towards Lotte World.
Turn left in front of the outdoor parking lot to arrive at the Kidzania.

data.title: Kidzania Seoul (ÌÇ§ÏûêÎãàÏïÑ ÏÑúÏö∏)
data.description: Kidzania, located in Jamsil, Songpa-gu, Seoul, is a unique family entertainment space especially for children ages 3 to 16. The theme park provides children with a chance to experience jobs that they might want to have when they grow up! Job experiences include working as a policeman, flight attendant, firefighter, or chef (uniforms are provided). When you work hard in Kidzania, you get paid in Kidzo (a virtual currency). You can put your money in the bank for your next visit or purchase goods at the department store. In order to make the environment as realistic as possible, every building, car, and tree is reduced to 2/3 its real size, helping children feel more adult-like in their new world! Kidzania mimics a real city environment, has diverse jobs, and is full of events. When there is a fire, a fireman rushes to help, and a news reporter covers the story. While 911 paramedics give first aid to fire victims, in another part of ‚Äútown‚Äù delivery personnel are dropping off packages. Kidzania teaches the next generation how to live as responsible members of society and gives them an introduction to how the economy works.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Namsan Outdoor Botanical Garden (ÎÇ®ÏÇ∞ ÏïºÏô∏ÏãùÎ¨ºÏõê)
dataList.description: Namsan Outdoor Botanical Garden opened its doors on February 18, 1997 in Hannam-dong, where the residential complex for foreigners once stood before it was demolished in 1994. Covering an area of around 59 „é°, it is divided into 13 themed gardens with a total 117,132 plants from 269 species. Among this diversity, 60,912 plants from 129 species are tree types and 56,220 plants from 140 species are grass types.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Namsan Octagonal Pavilion (ÎÇ®ÏÇ∞ ÌåîÍ∞ÅÏ†ï)
dataList.description: Originally known as Unamjeong Pavilion, the pavilion was built in 1959 to commemorate Rhee Syngman. It was demolished by the 4.19 movement in 1960 and was rebuilt on November 11, 1968. This pavilion now sits atop Namsan Mountain, with views covering the entirety of Seoul below. As it is a prime spot to view the first sunrise of the year, the annual sunrise festival takes place every New Year's Day.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Namsan Cable Car (ÎÇ®ÏÇ∞ ÏºÄÏù¥Î∏îÏπ¥)
dataList.description: Namsan Cable Car provides a panoramic view of downtown Seoul. The cable car has been in operation for over 40 years, taking tourists and residents alike to Namsan Seoul Tower, one of the most representative tourist attractions in the city.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Nakseonjae Hall (ÎÇôÏÑ†Ïû¨)
dataList.description:
Located inside Changdeokgung Palace, Nakseonjae Hall is a one-story structure built in ikgong style (bird wing-shaped eaves placed on top of the pillars) with a hip tiled and gable roof. It has 6 kan in the front and 2 kan (traditional unit of measurement of the space between pillars) to the sides. It originally belonged to the nearby Changgyeonggung Palace, but came to be considered a part of Changdeokgung Palace in more recent years.

The hall was constructed in 1846 (12th year of King Heonjong‚Äôs reign) and it is collectively called Nakseonjae together with the adjacent Seokbokheon Hall and Sugangjae Hall.

Behind the building is a flower garden made of stacked large stones. The chimney, the flowers, and the oddly shaped stones harmoniously blend into one another to create an outstanding landscape gardening.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Naksan Park (ÎÇôÏÇ∞Í≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Naksan Park gets its name from its camel hump-like appearance. The mountain is a solid granite bedrock. The Joseon royal family enjoyed the natural beauty of the granite mountain, but during the Japanese Colonial Period, a hasty manner of urban planning resulted in the demolition of most parts of the mountain.  In an effort to save the remaining green belts, Naksan was designated as a park on June 10, 2002.  Located in the center of the Seoul, this historical and beautiful park allows its visitors to view the magnificence of the entire city.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: N. Olive Esthetic (Ïï§Ïò¨Î¶¨Î∏å ÏóêÏä§ÌÖåÌã±)
dataList.description: Located on the first underground floor of Times Square in Yeongdeungpo, N. Olive Esthetic is a spa and beauty care shop. It offers professional nail art, hand and foot care and skin and full body therapies. Services include specialty packages like the Oil Candle Therapy (aroma oil produced from melted candles) using beauty care items from France. Every service includes a foot massage.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Myogaksa Temple-Seoul (Î¨òÍ∞ÅÏÇ¨ (ÏÑúÏö∏))
dataList.description: Located east of Naksan Mountain at Sungin-dong, Jongno-gu in Seoul, Myogaksa Temple offers the urbanites a chance to experience Temple Stay. Since 2002, Myogaksa Temple has run its special Temple Stay program titled ‚ÄúFree from All Anxiety‚Äù, which sees a growing number of foreign participants every year. Moreover, you may also have a chance to experience Korean traditional culture as well as get to know Korean history better through interesting stories.
dataList.author: korea-tour
